alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 7:52PM CDT until May 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Harrah affecting Lincoln, Oklahoma and Pottawatomie Counties.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC081-109-125-051300- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.Y.0004.000000T0000Z-220506T1200Z/ /HRHO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 752 PM CDT Wed May 4 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Harrah. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Shallow flooding of low-lying areas along the river may occur in eastern Oklahoma County... the southwest corner of Lincoln County... and northwestern Pottawatomie County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
